question.title: Liquibase ValidationFailedException and Logging Error
question.body:
I have two issues with Liquibase.

  1. When deploying my war file I get the error:

     15:31:25.985 [main] WARN org.hibernate.orm.deprecation -- HHH90000012: Recognized obsolete hibernate namespace http://hibernate.sourceforge.net/hibernate-mapping. Use namespace http://www.hibernate.org/dtd/hibernate-mapping instead.  Support for obsolete DTD/XSD namespaces may be removed at any time.

Sorry, I just am not able to format the logs at all.

I had added the liquibase plugin in the master pom to overcome this:

<plugin>
    <groupId>org.liquibase</groupId>
    <artifactId>liquibase-maven-plugin</artifactId>
    <configuration>
        <clearCheckSums>true</clearCheckSums>
    </configuration>
</plugin>

But without any luck.

Second one is, how do i get the liquibase logging issue:

liquibase.exception.UnexpectedLiquibaseException: Cannot find default log service
        at liquibase.Scope.getCurrentScope(Scope.java:110)
        at liquibase.configuration.ConfigurationDefinition.getCurrentConfiguredValue(ConfigurationDefinition.java:100)
        at liquibase.configuration.ConfigurationDefinition.getCurrentConfiguredValue(ConfigurationDefinition.java:90)
        at liquibase.configuration.ConfigurationDefinition.getCurrentValue(ConfigurationDefinition.java:64)
        at liquibase.util.StreamUtil.getLineSeparator(StreamUtil.java:17)

I am currently using:

Spring 6.2.0. MySQL Server is 9.0.1. Hibernate Core version of 6.6.3.Final. liquibase-core version of 4.30.0.

This is not a spring boot app. I hope i provided all the info, if you need anymore, please let me know, I will update the question.

question_comments.body: Yep, need to remove all data from DB and probably the schema too and error should gone
@AndreyB.Panfilov Yes, skipping it for now. Or like how to fix it. Do i delete the schema from the DB to get over this? And logging error.

What answer are you expecting? Liquibase clearly tells you that smth. is going wrong (in particular: change sets applied previously do not match current state of code/db). Are you asking whether you may ignore warnings and go ahead?
